intro: Origanum diffusum, commonly known as sweet marjoram, is a perennial herb native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers and has fragrant, oval-shaped leaves that are often used in cooking and herbal medicine. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for Mediterranean climates. Its essential oils contain compounds like carvacrol and thymol, which contribute to its medicinal and aromatic properties.
